snippet: The foreign aid for the survivors of Typhoon Haiyan is shaping up to be a monumental show of international largess — and a dose of one-upmanship directed at China.
abstract: Outpouring of foreign assistance for the Philippines in the wake of Typhoon Haiyan is shaping up to be a monumental show of international largess; amount of foreign aid is also a not-so-subtle dose of one-upmanship directed at China, which has been notably penurious.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Martin Fackler from Tokyo, Jane Perlez from Beijing, Thom Shanker from Washington, Rick Gladstone from New York, and Keith Bradsher from Tacloban, the Philippines.

lead_paragraph: The foreign aid for the survivors of Typhoon Haiyan is shaping up to be a monumental show of international largess — and a dose of one-upmanship directed at China.

headline.main: Asia Rivalries Play Role in Aid to the Philippines
headline.print_headline: Asia Rivalries Play Role In Aid to the Philippines

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
